page.title: 10Stratford_on_Avon Canal
page.content: The famous{Josiah Wedgewood }of Stoke_ on_Trent,instigated the construction of the Stratford Canal.He wanted a cheap and reliable form of transport to carry his pottery. Roads were bumpy in the eighteenth century and his goods were often damaged.He hired {James Brindley}to build the network of canals known as the {Grand Cross}using the rivers Mersey,Severn,Trent and Thames.His goods were then able to be taken from Birmingham to London, Bristol,Liverpool,Manchester and Hull for export.The{Stratford Canal}was started in 1792, it finished at the Wharf Inn, Hockley Heath,this remained its terminus for twenty years.It was finally completed in 1816,but in 1823 a{Reservoir}was built at Earlswood to improve water supplies.Today,the canal is used purely for leisure activities.
